t: Amazon.com: Customer Questions & Answers
s: As far as I can tell, the difference seems to be the type of tip on the needles. Turbos are more blunt than the other two. Turbo lace has more taper and a more pointed end of the tip while the rockets are more pointed than the turbos and less than the lace needles.

t: Amazon.com: addi Circular Turbo Rocket Lace Skacel Blue Cord 40 inch (100cm) Size US 0 (2.0mm)
s: These are my favorite knitting needles. They are high quality with smooth joins from the cable to the needle, and the cable is supple, not stiff. I own a couple of needles in another premium brand that were three times the price, but they honestly aren’t any better than these Addi Turbo Rockets.

t: Addi Turbo Rocket Circular Needles by Skacel| Purl Soho
Addi Turbo Rockets and Sock Rockets - Knitter's Review
s: September 21, 2016 - Addi Turbos are the Cadillac of nickel-plated brass circular knitting needles, setting a standard against which all others in the market compete. The needles are all made in Germany, to exacting specifications and in impeccable working conditions, and they all carry a lifetime warranty.

s: I recently purchased the addi lace interchangeable circular set, which comes with a nice case. When I don't have this with me or something else, these needles still hold up perfectly being stuffed uncovered into my knitting bag. Amazon.com: addi Turbo Rockets 16-inch (40cm) Circular Knitting Needle; Size US 10 (6.00 mm)
s: Addi Turbo Rockets are awesome. I have several in different sizes. Their sharp points allow for easy decreases and bind offs. The smooth finish on needles and smooth joins where plastic line meets needles allows yarn to slide with ease. The plastic line is strong, but allows adequate bending for magic loop. I really miss these needles when I use other brands...

t: Amazon.com: addi Turbo Rockets 24-inch (60cm) Circular Knitting Needle; Size US 05 (3.75 mm) 775-24-05
Addi Turbo vs Addi Turbo Rocket? : r/knitting
s: Hi knitters, I have a question for you all. I recently ordered two pairs of Addi Turbo Rocket circular knitting needles by mistake instead of regular Addi Turbo circular needles. I'm a huge fan of Addi Turbo needles, but I've never used the Rocket needles before.
